meanings.def: used for showing how or in what way something is done
examples: The house is heated by gas.
May I pay by credit card?
I will contact you by letter.
to travel by boat/bus/car/plane
to travel by air/land/sea
Switch it on by pressing this button.

meanings.def: near somebody/something; at the side of somebody/something; next to somebody/something
examples: a house by the river
The telephone is by the window.
Come and sit by me.

meanings.def: used, usually after a passive verb, to show who or what does, creates or causes something
examples: He was knocked down by a bus.
a play by Ibsen
Who's that book by?
I was frightened by the noise.
Some people buy all their groceries online.
I think he was motivated by his mother.
Don't let the opportunity pass you by.
Bye! See you later.

meanings.def: not later than the time mentioned; before
examples: Can you finish the work by five o'clock?
I'll have it done by tomorrow.
By this time next week we'll be in New York.
He ought to have arrived by now/by this time.
By the time (that) this letter reaches you I will have left the country.

meanings.def: used before particular nouns without the, to say that something happens as a result of something
examples: They met by chance.
I did it by mistake.
The coroner's verdict was ‘death by misadventure’.

meanings.def: used to show the degree or amount of something
examples: The bullet missed him by two inches.
House prices went up by 10%.
It would be better by far (= much better) to…

meanings.def: during something; in a particular situation
examples: to travel by day/night
We had to work by candlelight.

meanings.def: from what something shows or says; according to something
examples: By my watch it is two o'clock.
I could tell by the look on her face that something terrible had happened.
By law, you are a child until you are 18.

meanings.def: past somebody/something
examples: He walked by me without speaking.

meanings.def: used to show the part of somebody/something that somebody touches, holds, etc.
examples: I took him by the hand.
She seized her by the hair.
Pick it up by the handle!

meanings.def: used with the to show the period or quantity used for buying, selling or measuring something
examples: We rented the car by the day.
They're paid by the hour.
We only sell it by the metre.

meanings.def: used to state the rate at which something happens
examples: They're improving day by day.
We'll do it bit by bit.
It was getting worse by the minute (= very fast).
The children came in two by two (= in groups of two).

meanings.def: used to show the measurements of something
examples: The room measures fifteen feet by twenty feet.

meanings.def: used when multiplying or dividing
examples: 6 multiplied by 2 equals 12.
6 divided by 2 equals 3.

meanings.def: used for giving more information about where somebody comes from, what somebody does, etc.
examples: He's German by birth.
They're both doctors by profession.

meanings.def: used when swearing to mean ‘in the name of’
examples: I swear by Almighty God…

meanings.def: used to introduce a comment or question that is not directly related to what you have been talking about

idioms.def: used to introduce a comment or question that is not directly related to what you have been talking about

meanings.def: past
examples: Just drive by. Don't stop.
He hurried by without speaking to me.
Excuse me, I can't get by.
Time goes by so quickly.
Some people buy all their groceries online.
I think he was motivated by his mother.
Don't let the opportunity pass you by.
Bye! See you later.

meanings.def: used to say that something is saved so that it can be used in the future
examples: I've put some money by for college fees.

meanings.def: in order to visit somebody for a short time
examples: I'll come by this evening and pick up the books.

meanings.def: before long; soon
examples: By and by she met an old man with a beard.

meanings.def: used when you are saying something that is generally, but not completely, true
examples: By and large, I enjoyed my time at school.
Women generally earn less than men.
Generally speaking, jobs traditionally done by women are paid at a lower rate than those traditionally done by men.
In general/By and large, women do not earn as much as men.
Certain jobs, like nursing and cleaning, are still mainly carried out by women.
Senior management posts are predominantly held by men.
Most senior management posts tend to be held by men.
Women are, for the most part, still paid less than men.
Economic and social factors are, to a large extent, responsible for women being concentrated in low-paid jobs.
By and by she met an old man with a beard.

idioms.def: used when you are saying something that is generally, but not completely, true
examples: By and large, I enjoyed my time at school.
Women generally earn less than men.
Generally speaking, jobs traditionally done by women are paid at a lower rate than those traditionally done by men.
In general/By and large, women do not earn as much as men.
Certain jobs, like nursing and cleaning, are still mainly carried out by women.
Senior management posts are predominantly held by men.
Most senior management posts tend to be held by men.
Women are, for the most part, still paid less than men.
Economic and social factors are, to a large extent, responsible for women being concentrated in low-paid jobs.

meanings.def: less important
examples: a by-product

meanings.def: near
examples: a bystander
